Dear Mr. Thompson,

I hope you are doing well. I’m writing to provide a concise update on our department’s current compliance status.

1. Regulatory Alignment
   • We completed a line-by-line review of the newest federal and state regulations governing international student programs. No discrepancies were found between the requirements and our existing practices.

2. Faculty & Staff Training
   • 100 % of faculty and pertinent staff have completed the newly released compliance briefing and signed the annual attestation forms.
   • Refresher training has been scheduled each semester to ensure continued awareness.

3. Documentation & Audit Readiness
   • All compliance-related policies, procedures, and evidence logs have been consolidated in a central repository.
   • Spot-checks conducted last week matched our documented processes with on-ground practice, confirming readiness for any external audit.

4. Policy Updates
   • Minor procedural tweaks (e.g., extended document-retention window from 5 to 7 years) have been incorporated into the department handbook and communicated to staff.
   • An FAQ sheet was circulated to address questions raised during the recent meeting.

Next Steps
   • We will keep monitoring forthcoming guidance and update our materials within two weeks of any changes.
   • A quarterly internal audit cycle will begin in July to maintain continuous compliance.

In summary, our department remains fully compliant with current regulations, and all supporting evidence is organized and audit-ready. Please let me know if you would like a more detailed report or have any specific questions.

Thank you for your support.

Best regards,
[Your Name]
[Your Position]
[Your Department]
[University/Organization]
